newsitem.title: CANADA: Alberta crops stressed by drought, excess rain.
newsitem.headline: Alberta crops stressed by drought, excess rain.

text.p: Alberta crops suffered drought stress in the south and east, and excess moisture in the north, Alberta Agriculture said in its crop report for the week ended July 21.

"While crops in southern and eastern Alberta have begun to suffer from drought stress, crops in the north and eastern sections of the Peace River region are still dealing with excessive moisture," wrote Wendy Boje, Alberta Agriculture's crop statistician.
South Alberta crops began to show signs of drought stress. Yields may drop soon if there is no rain in the coming week.
Central Alberta crops fared better in the west than the east where crops were stressed by drought.
Northeast Alberta cereal and oilseed crops did not fare well due to lack of rain in the past few weeks.
Northwest Alberta crops may not be ideal but conditions generally improved.
Peace River Valley crops were very wet except for the southeastern corner.
